Compounds

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
subSections.text:
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|葦鹿|あしか}}: [[sea lion]]
* {{ja-r|大鹿|おおじか}}: [[moose]]
* {{ja-r|氈鹿|かもしか}}: [[serow]]
* {{ja-r|鹿猪|しかいのしし}}: [[babirusa]]
* {{ja-r|鹿肉|しかにく}}: [[venison]]
* {{ja-r|麝香鹿|じゃこうじか}}: [[musk deer]]
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-r|馴鹿|トナカイ}}, {{ja-r|馴鹿|じゅんろく}}: [[reindeer]]
* {{ja-r|日本鹿|にほんじか}}: [[sika deer]]
* {{ja-r|馬鹿|ばか}}: [[fool]]
* {{ja-r|麋鹿|びろく}}: [[moose]] and [[deer]]
* {{ja-r|箆鹿|へらじか}}: [[moose]]
* {{ja-r|鹿砦|ろくさい}}: [[abatis]]
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: Etymology 2
Noun
Idioms
Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かせぎ}}
From the resemblance to a {{m|ja|桛木||tr=kasegi|cross-shaped spindle; a branching point in a tree}}

subSections.title: Noun
Etymology 4
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かのしし}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=かのしし|鹿|tr1=ka|t1=deer|の|tr2=no|pos2=possessive particle|肉|tr3=しし|t3=meat, flesh}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

subSections.title: Etymology 5
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=kun|しし}}
From {{m|ja|肉|tr=shishi||meat, flesh}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: The ''beast'' sense is more commonly spelled {{ja-l|獣}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 6
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ろく}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ろく}} {{m|zh|鹿|tr=luwk||deer}}. Compare modern {{etyl|nan|-}} reading ''lo̍k''.
